snippet: Last year, President Obama’s call for new pay rules was a politically useful tool in the midterm campaigns. But now it’s time to finally take action.
abstract: Editorial contends time for Obama administration and Labor Department to overhaul nation's outdated rules on overtime pay is running out, with February deadline for proposal having passed; says White House should strive to meet demands for threshold of at least $1,000 per week at which salaried workers cease to be eligible for overtime; warns that failure to act could result in no changes to law if Republican president is elected in 2016.
lead_paragraph: Last year, President Obama’s call for new pay rules was a politically useful tool in the midterm campaigns. But now it’s time to finally take action.
